Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Circus Life and Grasso's Initial Threat
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Paul Bunyan in his circus act and the initial excitement surrounding the circus arrival. It then transitions into a tense confrontation where Paul, under the alias 'Carrumba Matto Grasso', defends himself and faces an unexpected pistol threat, setting up the initial conflict with Grasso.

sub_scenes.title: Circus Arrival and Paul Bunyan's Performance
sub_scenes.description: This scene establishes Paul Bunyan's role as a circus performer and the town's enthusiastic reaction to the circus's arrival.

sub_scenes.title: Under Tent Trouble and Pistol Threat
sub_scenes.description: This scene transitions to a tense indoor confrontation where 'Billings', revealed as 'Carrumba Matto Grasso' (Paul Bunyan), faces threats and violence, escalating to a dangerous pistol standoff.

Major_Arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Recruitment and Grasso's Revenge Plots
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc covers Paul Bunyan's recruitment into the circus, replacing Grasso, and Grasso's subsequent vengeful plots to sabotage Paul and the circus, leading to dramatic confrontations.

sub_scenes.title: Recruitment as Circus Strongman
sub_scenes.description: This scene details Paul Bunyan's interaction with the circus owner, revealing Grasso's backstory and leading to Paul accepting the role of the new strongman.

sub_scenes.title: Grasso's Sabotage Attempts and Paul's Interventions
sub_scenes.description: This scene showcases Grasso's escalating revenge plots, first with arson and then with releasing a dangerous ape, both thwarted by Paul Bunyan's strength and quick action.

narrative_arcs.title: Paul Bunyan's Acclaim and Grasso's Envy

Major_Arcs.title: The Chase and Capture of Grasso, Paul's Departure
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the chase and ultimate capture of Grasso by Paul Bunyan, culminating in Grasso's humiliation and Paul's decision to leave the circus life, returning to his preferred solitude.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase Through the Circus Arena
sub_scenes.description: This scene focuses on the pursuit of Grasso by Paul Bunyan through the circus grounds and arena, marked by Grasso's desperate attempts to evade capture using tricks and obstacles.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Arena and New Plan
Bucket as a Trick and Continued Escape
The Turn to Fight and Capture
The Trapeze Toss and Audience Reaction

sub_scenes.title: Grasso's Capture and Paul's Farewell
sub_scenes.description: This scene concludes the Grasso storyline with his official capture and transitions to Paul Bunyan's decision to reject the circus job and return to his solitary life in the woods.

Major_Arcs.title: Marco Polo and the Awful Ogress of Tibet
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Marco Polo and his encounter with the Awful Ogress of Tibet. It begins with a mysterious encounter, shifts to a bizarre talking severed head, and leads Marco to Hi-toun and the ominous Witch's Castle.

sub_scenes.title: Initial Encounter and Severed Head
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Marco Polo and transitions to a strange encounter with a talking severed head in a forest, setting a tone of mystery and the supernatural.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Encounter with the Ogress

sub_scenes.title: Sacred Dagger and Journey to Mourning City
sub_scenes.description: This scene involves a magical dagger received as thanks and Marco Polo's arrival at a city in mourning, a stark contrast to his initial festive perception.

narrative_arcs.title: The Sacred Dagger and Debt Repayment
The Question of the Knife's Inaction and Farewell

sub_scenes.title: Hi-toun and the Witch's Castle
sub_scenes.description: This scene brings Marco Polo to Hi-toun, introduces the King and the plight of Princess Lotus's disappearance, leading him to a starving woman and her 'Witch's Castle' home.

narrative_arcs.title: Marco Polo's Arrival and Royal Welcome
The King's Grief and Princess Lotus's Disappearance
A Plea from a Starving Woman

sub_scenes.title: Inside the Ogress's Castle and Confrontation
sub_scenes.description: This scene reveals the true nature of the 'Witch's Castle' and the old woman as an Ogress, culminating in a confrontation with monstrous mice and the Ogress herself.

narrative_arcs.title: Entering the Mysterious Castle and Strange Children
Confrontation with Monstrous Mice and Sword Drawn

Major_Arcs.title: Ogress's Defeat and Princess Lotus's Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc details the fight against the Ogress, the rescue of Princess Lotus, and the resolution of Marco Polo's involvement in Hi-toun, concluding with his departure.

sub_scenes.title: Ogress's Defeat and Escape
sub_scenes.description: This scene initially seems to depict a separate conflict with a cloaked figure and snakes, but it is actually a detour before returning to the Ogress storyline, setting up the means for her defeat.

narrative_arcs.title: Discovery of the Special Knife and Hope
Escape from the Dungeon with the Magic Knife

sub_scenes.title: Reunion and Marco Polo's Farewell
sub_scenes.description: This scene concludes Marco Polo's adventure in Hi-toun, featuring the reunion with Princess Lotus's father, cultural misunderstanding, and Marco's refusal of reward, leading to his departure.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and the Misunderstanding of Black Drapes

Major_Arcs.title: Davy Jones's Treasure and Jordan's Revenge
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells a tale of betrayal, imprisonment, and revenge centered around Davy Jones's treasure. It follows Joseph Jordan's quest for justice after being betrayed by Captain Brooking.

sub_scenes.title: Treasure Tale Prologue and Penal Colony
sub_scenes.description: This scene sets up the narrative with a prologue about treasure and introduces the setting of a British penal colony where the story of betrayal begins.

sub_scenes.title: The Bargain and the Betrayal
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the initial bargain between Jordan and Captain Brooking for treasure and escape, followed by Brooking's betrayal and Jordan's subsequent imprisonment.

sub_scenes.title: Vigil, Confrontation, and Revenge
sub_scenes.description: This scene showcases Jordan's relentless pursuit of Brooking, their confrontation, and Jordan's violent revenge to reclaim the treasure.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation and Resolution at Brooking's Home
Journey to the Attic and Treasure Reveal
Police Investigate Shot and Discover Body

Major_Arcs.title: Dr. Styx and the Haunted Matthews Estate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc follows Dr. Styx, a supernatural expert, as he investigates the haunted Matthews Estate, confronting ghostly presences and uncovering deeper emotional and spiritual resolutions.

sub_scenes.title: Introduction to Dr. Styx and the Haunted Estate Problem
sub_scenes.description: This scene introduces Dr. Styx in a mysterious encounter, followed by a courtroom sentencing, and transitions to the setup of the haunted Matthews Estate problem.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation and Resolution with Vincent Matthews's Ghost
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts Mr. Northrup's entry into the haunted house, his confrontation with Vincent Matthews's ghost, a physical struggle, and ultimately a resolution through forgiveness and brotherly love, facilitated by Dr. Styx.

narrative_arcs.title: Initial Attack and Claim of Power
Questioning Violence and Shifting Power Dynamics
Confession of Fear and Societal Position
The Solution of Forgiveness and Love
The Revelation of Rosalind and the Murder
Demand for Brotherly Love and Release

Major_Arcs.title: Henry Hudson's Quest for the Northwest Passage
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc chronicles Henry Hudson's persistent voyages to find the Northwest Passage, his initial backing by the Dutch East India Company, the challenges faced, mutiny, and his ultimate tragic fate.

sub_scenes.title: Hudson's Commission and First Voyage
sub_scenes.description: This scene sets the historical context of Henry Hudson's life and details his commission by the Dutch East India Company for his first voyage to find the Northwest Passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Enigma of Henry Hudson's Fate
The Dutch East India Company's Proposition

sub_scenes.title: First Voyage Disappointment and Return
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the challenges and disappointments of Hudson's first voyage, including crew tensions, exploration of the Hudson River, and the eventual return to Holland.

narrative_arcs.title: Rising Tensions and a Turn Southward
Entering the Hudson River with Hope
Hudson's Resignation and Decision to Return

sub_scenes.title: Second Voyage, Wintering, and Mutiny
sub_scenes.description: This scene covers Hudson's second voyage, backed by a new company, his ship getting trapped in ice, the harsh winter conditions, and ultimately the crew's mutiny against him.

narrative_arcs.title: Another Voyage Backed by a New Company
Trapped in Ice and Winter Quarters
The Ice Melts and Disagreement Over Course
Scuffle and Ousting of Captain Hudson
Captain Hudson Set Adrift and Mutineers' Departure

Major_Arcs.title: Hassan the Arabian Knight and the Rescue Mission
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc tells the story of Hassan, the Arabian Knight, and his daring rescue mission to save the daughter of Ali-Ben-Ali from the Tartar leader Kurgan, filled with action, combat, and a touch of romance.

sub_scenes.title: The Chase and the Caliph's Mission
sub_scenes.description: This scene opens with Hassan in a desperate chase, then flashbacks to the Caliph commissioning him for a rescue mission to save Ali-Ben-Ali's daughter kidnapped by Kurgan.

narrative_arcs.title: Summoned by the Caliph for a Rescue Mission

sub_scenes.title: Journey, Warnings, and Camp Infiltration
sub_scenes.description: This scene follows Hassan's journey towards the Tartar camp, encountering warnings along the way, and his stealthy infiltration into the camp under disguise.

narrative_arcs.title: Setting off to Confront the Tartars
Inside the Tartar Camp and Confirmation of the Daughter

sub_scenes.title: Contact, Capture, and Kurgan's Challenge
sub_scenes.description: This scene details Hassan's contact with the prisoner, his detection and capture by Tartar soldiers, and his confrontation with Kurgan, who proposes a deadly challenge.

narrative_arcs.title: Detection and Confrontation by Tartar Soldiers

sub_scenes.title: The Contest and its Aftermath
sub_scenes.description: This scene depicts the contest itself, where Hassan, unarmed, cleverly defeats three Tartar warriors, followed by the negotiation with Kurgan for the promised reward and safe passage.

narrative_arcs.title: The Signal and the Start of the Contest
Dirt as a Weapon and Initial Attack
Exploiting the Advantage and Close Combat

sub_scenes.title: Farewell and Budding Romance
sub_scenes.description: This scene concludes Hassan's mission with farewells from Kurgan and the woman, and subtly develops a romantic undertone between Hassan and the rescued woman, culminating in a kiss.
